markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

ctvnews.ca  (WEB - en-US)

The website for CTV News, the news-gathering operation of Canadian television network CTV.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

CTV is a division of Bell Media, which is owned by publicly traded, Quebec-based BCE Inc., a Canadian communications company that also owns telephone and wireless Internet services. Bell Media runs 30 local TV stations, 30 specialty channels, and more than 100 Canadian radio stations.

BCE Inc. also holds investments in professional hockey teams the Montreal Canadiens and Toronto Raptors and the National Basketball Association’s Toronto Maple Leafs.

CTVNews.ca runs advertisements and sponsored content.

Content

CTVNews.ca’s coverage focuses on Canada’s national government as well as crime and lifestyle stories. Sections include Politics, Sci-Tech, Health, Sports, Lifestyle, Real Estate, Business, and Autos. A Local tab on the main navigation menu allows users to access content specific to 20 Canadian regions, including Calgary, Northern Ontario, and the Atlantic region.

A special section is devoted to the rollout of legalized recreational marijuana in Canada. Users can also watch clips from W5, CTV’s long-running newsmagazine television program. Typical stories have run under such headlines as “Former foreign affairs minister John Manley says he 'would not travel to China right now;” “Huge dirt mound in Montreal neighbourhood unsafe: report;” and “Following Alzheimer's diagnosis, this 81-year-old Ont. man enrolled in university.”

In addition to its Canadian staff, CTV News has reporters based in the U.S. and the U.K. CTV News supplements its coverage with newswires including The Canadian Press and The Associated Press.

Credibility

Stories typically are based around videos from CTV News’s original reporting, which generally relies on multiple interviews with such sources as government officials, community leaders, and subject-matter experts. Headlines accurately reflect content.

The site generally does not publish opinion content, although there is a section devoted to host Don Martin’s politics blog, which contains opinionated posts. The section makes clear the feature is a blog, and headlines indicate that the posts contain Martin’s opinion and analysis.

The site does not articulate a corrections policy, but NewsGuard found multiple examples of corrections, usually in the form of italicized notes at the bottom of stories.

Transparency

Some articles do not identify authors by name and instead are credited to “CTVNews.ca Staff.” However, text articles often appear with newscast videos that identify on-air reporters. Other reports identify CTV News journalists at local stations.

The site provides biographical information about CTV News’ on-air and digital journalists as well as profile pages for its digital content editors and for a CTV National News senior editor.

CTV News’s parent company, Bell Media, is acknowledged in an About page, which links to Bell Media’s corporate site.

Advertisements and sponsored content are distinguished from editorial content. Readers can click on an icon above sponsored stories to access a page explaining how the sponsored content is produced.

History

CTV was founded in 1961. Most of the network’s programming consists of hit American series, including “The Big Bang Theory,” “Dancing with the Stars,” and “Grey’s Anatomy,” although it also airs some Canadian-produced shows, along with its news coverage.

Written by:
Sam Howard

Edited by:
Eric Effron Macaela Bennett
